before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"697s8","text":"We acquired adult female ticks from the Oklahoma State University Tick Rearing Facility and experimented with one temperature range and three relative humidities. This protocol can be modified for different species, life stages, temperatures, humidities, and other small organisms. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"e0ao9","text":"This protocol details a novel method to isolate individual ticks and manipulate their environment. We successfully used this method to investigate how humidity affects survival and host-seeking (questing) behavior of three species of ticks: the lone star tick (Amblyomma americanum), American dog tick (Dermacentor variabilis), and black-legged tick (Ixodes scapularis). We placed 72 adult females of each species into individual plastic tubes and separated them into three experimental relative humidity (RH) treatments representing distinct climates: 32% RH, 58% RH, and 84% RH. For 30 days we assessed the survival and questing behavior of each tick.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"blsjs","text":"Questing qualifications: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7ud2v","text":"The individual is not walking but it is still with its front legs extended       ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":76,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":78,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"525qj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bi3b1","text":"Death qualifications: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e21ss","text":"If any tick appears dead, lightly blow on it since ticks respond to carbon dioxide exhaled by potential hosts","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"p1ug","text":"If the tick does not move at all in 2 minutes, it should be counted as dead and placed in 70% ethanol","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"AF2B95C0D21811ECAC1B57FC252854EF","height":206.2885795454543,"id":246845,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":9,"offset":14,"style":"italic"}],"key":"39i5q","text":"Example {"blocks":[{"key":"96rks","text":"To create a 12:12 light:dark photoperiod, lighting increments should be as follows:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3dud5","text":"9:00 - Lights on","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1eldt","text":"21:00 - Lights off","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dl5ak","text":"Place all of the airtight containers, filled with ticks and humidity packs, into the climate chamber and start the program","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e7f0b","text":"Each day thereafter, during the 9:00 to 12:00 or   increment, assess each tick for survivorship and questing behavior (see guidelines for qualifications of survivorship and questing)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":49,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"9d2oh","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"1qlsh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"44tuj","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"7u60o","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8f2gu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"AC6DEB20DAC511ECA93D23CD5D9BFC56","id":"49923","label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"30","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ev76b","text":"Only take one container out of the chamber at a time","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cdljn","text":"Collect a binary outcome for survivorship and questing, and measure the tick's height (to the nearest 0.5 cm) in the tube if it is found questing","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"93f10","text":"Periodically move the data logger to a new bin to confirm that no unexpected changes to the climate inside the containers has occurred","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9hmkf","text":"Repeat steps 4 and 5 for 30 days or until all ticks have died","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"fu4hk","text":"Always handle ticks with blunt entomology forceps, as regular forceps can injure them. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fb9mp","text":"Always handle ticks over a white surface so that they can easily be spotted in case they are dropped.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
